entities.criteria: The cost associated with the plan as defined in the document. Extract premium rates, contribution amounts, or pricing structures exactly as shown. This may include employee-paid, employer-paid, or split contributions, and may be expressed as dollar amounts, percentages, or payroll-based rates.
Describes when age-based rates are recalculated following a participant’s birthday. Extract the timing rule exactly as stated (e.g., on birthday, end of month, next policy anniversary).
The date on which coverage under the plan becomes effective. Extract the effective date or coverage start date exactly as written. Do not infer dates unless explicitly stated.

queries.details: Eligibility/Enrollment/Termination/Leave/Continuation sections; capture exact rule text, time windows, and effective/end dates.

entities.criteria: Return one concise sentence summarizing who is eligible for coverage based on employment status and required work hours. Exclude procedural steps, waiting period details, and legal language.
Return one concise sentence summarizing eligibility based on student status and any applicable age limits. If not addressed, return “Not applicable.” Exclude procedural or documentation language.
Return one concise sentence indicating whether domestic partners or common-law relationships are eligible for coverage. Exclude documentation, affidavits, and administrative requirements.
Return one concise sentence stating whether a legal spouse is eligible for coverage and any high-level eligibility conditions. Exclude procedural or enrollment language.
Return one concise sentence summarizing eligibility for dependent children, including age limits or dependency requirements. Exclude administrative or continuation details.
Return one concise sentence summarizing how long an eligible individual must wait before coverage becomes effective and when the waiting period begins. Exclude examples and procedural wording.
Return one concise sentence summarizing when and under what circumstances the plan or contract may be terminated. Exclude notice periods, administrative requirements, and legal clauses.
Return one concise sentence summarizing when employee coverage ends due to termination of employment or loss of eligibility. Exclude COBRA, notice, or administrative details.
Rules describing how coverage is handled following rehire, temporary layoff, or break in service. Extract reinstatement timelines, conditions, and any evidence requirements exactly as written.
Describes how coverage is treated during approved leaves of absence. Extract continuation rules, duration limits, and premium responsibility exactly as stated.
Indicates whether benefits or premiums are subject to FICA taxation and/or reported for tax purposes. Extract the tax treatment exactly as described.
The percentage of pre-disability earnings payable as an LTD benefit, subject to a stated maximum monthly dollar amount. Extract both the benefit percentage and the maximum benefit exactly as written.
The maximum length of time LTD benefits are payable for a covered disability. Extract the duration exactly as stated (e.g., “To age 65”, “5 years”, “Social Security Normal Retirement Age”).
The waiting period between the onset of disability and the start of LTD benefit payments. Extract the duration exactly as written (e.g., “180 days”).
Describes eligibility for partial or residual disability benefits when an insured can work in a reduced capacity. Extract the definition and eligibility conditions exactly as stated.
Return one concise sentence summarizing whether disabilities related to pre-existing conditions are excluded and for how long. Prefer a standardized format (e.g., “3/12 limitation”) when applicable.

Return one concise sentence defining disability based on the inability to perform the material duties of the insured’s own occupation, including any stated transition to another definition. Exclude legal qualifiers.
Indicates whether premium payments are waived while the insured is receiving LTD benefits. Extract the conditions and effective timing exactly as written.
Indicates whether LTD coverage may be continued after employment ends, typically by direct payment. Extract eligibility requirements, time limits, and benefit changes exactly as stated.
Indicates whether LTD coverage may be converted to an individual policy upon loss of eligibility. Extract conversion rights, deadlines, and limitations exactly as written.
Defines what compensation components are used to calculate LTD benefits (e.g., base salary, bonuses, commissions). Extract the definition exactly as stated.
Describes when LTD benefit calculations are updated following a change in earnings. Extract the timing rule exactly as written (e.g., on date of change, next policy anniversary).
Describes income sources that reduce LTD benefits, such as Social Security, workers’ compensation, or other disability income. Extract listed offsets exactly as stated.
Specifies benefit duration or payment limitations for certain conditions or diagnoses. Extract the conditions and limitation periods exactly as written.
Describes any benefit payable to surviving dependents upon the insured’s death while disabled. Extract eligibility and benefit amount exactly as stated.
Describes incentives or provisions allowing continued or partial benefits when returning to work. Extract conditions and duration exactly as written.
Indicates whether travel assistance or employee assistance program services are included, and whether benefits are insured or administrative only. Extract details exactly as stated.
Defines how post-disability earnings affect benefit eligibility or payment amounts. Extract thresholds and calculation rules exactly as written.
Indicates whether participation in rehabilitation programs is required to continue receiving LTD benefits. Extract requirements exactly as stated.
Describes services provided to assist disabled individuals in retraining or returning to work. Extract scope and eligibility exactly as written.
Return one concise sentence summarizing when partial disability benefits apply due to reduced work capacity and income loss. Exclude benefit calculation formulas.
Defines how benefits resume if a disability recurs after a temporary recovery or return to work. Extract timeframes and conditions exactly as written.
Return one high-level sentence summarizing the types of conditions or circumstances excluded or limited under the plan. Do not list individual exclusions unless explicitly required.

queries.details: Extract all questions and corresponding answers that define employee eligibility mechanics for LTD. Capture minimum hours worked (e.g., hours per week), the eligibility waiting period and when eligibility is met, the coverage effective date rule (e.g., first day of the month that coincides with or follows eligibility), and any active-at-work requirement that delays coverage or increases until return to active work. Also capture reinstatement/rehire rules that restore coverage without a new waiting period, including the reinstatement window in days (e.g., return within 90 days) for layoff/termination, involuntary reduction in hours, and approved leaves; include military leave timing only if explicitly stated.

entities.criteria: Questions about LTD eligibility mechanics, including hours/week thresholds, waiting period rules, when eligibility is achieved, coverage start timing (e.g., 1st of month), active-at-work gating, and reinstatement/rehire rules without a new waiting period with a stated window in days.

The corresponding answer, preserving stated numeric thresholds and timing rules exactly (hours, days, “1st of month” language), including active-at-work conditions and any reinstatement window and “no new waiting period” wording when present.

queries.details: Extract the termination provision that states when LTD coverage/insurance ends. Capture termination rules whether written as questions/answers, headings, or narrative clauses (e.g., “Termination of Insurance/Coverage,” “When Insurance Ends,” “Coverage will end,” “Insurance ends,” “Termination Date”). Prioritize rules tied to employment termination / cessation of employment / last day worked / termination date / end of active employment (including end-of-month/pay-period wording if stated). If the document uses “no longer eligible,” also capture any definition of eligibility that explicitly links ineligibility to employment ending. If an employment-termination rule exists, include it even if other termination triggers appear.

entities.criteria: Extract the exact question, heading, or clause label that introduces the termination rule (e.g., “When does coverage end?”, “When Insurance Ends”, “Termination of Insurance/Coverage”, “Coverage will end”). If no label exists, extract the leading phrase that signals the rule (e.g., “Insurance ends…”).

Extract the termination rule text that states the timing + trigger, preserving timing language exactly (e.g., “date of employment termination,” “last day worked,” “end of month,” “end of pay period”). Prefer the clause tied to employment termination when present; otherwise capture the most direct “coverage ends” rule stated.

queries.details: Extract all questions/answers or clause/heading + corresponding provision text that define partial disability and how partial benefits work under LTD. Capture the definition test (material duty + earnings threshold + timing), and prioritize any partial benefit mechanics that indicate an earnings-integrated design (e.g., 20% earnings threshold, benefit+earnings cap such as 100% of BME, reduction-by-excess formula, “incentive to work,” step changes like “after 2 years,” and maximum payable percent such as 85% of BME). Include only information explicitly stated.

entities.criteria: Questions, headings, or clause labels related to partial disability/residual benefits/earnings test/return-to-work and partial benefit calculation (e.g., “Partial Disability,” “Monthly Benefit for Partial Disability,” “Earnings Test,” “Work Incentive”).

The corresponding answer/provision text preserving explicit thresholds and formulas (percent of BME, caps like 100% of BME, reduction rules, timing triggers such as after elimination period or after 2 years).

queries.details: Extract questions/answers (or headings/clauses + provision text) that define Disability/Disabled under the LTD policy. Prioritize capturing the duty-based test (e.g., inability to perform material duties) and any earnings-based test (e.g., earnings must not exceed a stated % of pre-disability/basic monthly earnings). Capture any time-based transitions (e.g., after 24 months any occupation) only if explicitly part of the definition.

entities.criteria: Questions/headings/clauses about the definition of Disability/Disabled, especially those stating material duty requirements and any earnings threshold.
The corresponding definition text, preserving the duty test and earnings threshold wording/percent exactly.

queries.details: Extract the document’s Exclusions & Limitations language for LTD and capture evidence for five high-priority exclusions/limitations. First, identify whether a dedicated exclusions/limitations section exists and extract the heading and the verbatim text that belongs to that section (bullets/paragraphs/table rows) until the next major section break. Then, specifically locate and extract the exact wording (verbatim) for each targeted item if present: Pre-Existing Condition exclusion (include timeframes like 3/12, 3/6/12, etc.), Mental Health & Substance Use Disorder limitation/exclusion (include months if limited), Self-reported symptoms limitation/exclusion (include months if limited), Self-inflicted injury exclusion (present/not), and On-the-job injury/work-related injury exclusion (present/not). Do not infer; extract only explicit text.

entities.criteria: Extract the exact question text if the document is in Q&A form; otherwise extract the closest relevant section heading or subheading verbatim (e.g., “Exclusions,” “Limitations,” “Exclusions and Limitations,” “What’s Not Covered,” “General Exclusions,” “Limitations”). If extracting targeted items, use the closest heading/subheading that introduces that item (e.g., “Pre-Existing Condition Limitation,” “Mental Disorders Limitation,” “Self-Reported Symptoms,” “Self-Inflicted Injury,” “Work-Related Injury”).

Extract the verbatim text under the identified heading/question that contains the exclusions/limitations language. Include the full relevant clause(s) for the overall exclusions/limitations section and for each targeted item when found. Preserve timeframes (lookback/exclusion durations), month limits, definitions, and qualifiers exactly as written. If the section is long, capture the complete list content up to the next major section break; if that is not possible, capture the most complete continuous excerpt that contains the full exclusion list. Do not summarize; do not infer.
